intro: Leucophysalis kweichouense, commonly known as the Kweichou leucophysalis, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, herbaceous scent, contributing to its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
